results.content: This is a JavaScript basics course, advertised as "advanced knowledge". The course description, and the instructors profile are full of misleading and superficial stuff, eg. "change your life today" type bullshit. The course instructors personality is a fake, as is their company, Learn Tech Plus. They claim to have 900k students, yet a lot of their courses are given out for free frequently. This is obviously a scam operation, charging people for minimal knowledge. Please avoid all courses published by Learn Tech Plus.
results.content_html: This is a JavaScript basics course, advertised as "advanced knowledge". The course description, and the instructors profile are full of misleading and superficial stuff, eg. "change your life today" type bullshit. The course instructors personality is a fake, as is their company, Learn Tech Plus. They claim to have 900k students, yet a lot of their courses are given out for free frequently. This is obviously a scam operation, charging people for minimal knowledge. Please avoid all courses published by Learn Tech Plus.

results.content:
The content does not fit into "Advanced JavaScript". Not at all. I was expecting functional programming, higher-order function, the Es6 syntax, Clojure, JavaScript object-oriented programming, JavaScript Object prototype, among others. 
But I will agree that I did poor due diligence by not reading the course objective. I was taken away just by the "Advanced JavaScript" title.
results.content_html:
The content does not fit into "Advanced JavaScript". Not at all. I was expecting functional programming, higher-order function, the Es6 syntax, Clojure, JavaScript object-oriented programming, JavaScript Object prototype, among others.
But I will agree that I did poor due diligence by not reading the course objective. I was taken away just by the "Advanced JavaScript" title.

results.content: It is misleading to label this course Advanced JavaScript but have the majority of course content geared towards people with little to no programming experience. The project at the end of the course is even more misleading. It hardly incorporates anything from the previous sections, introduces jQuery for the first time in the course, and spends 30 minutes coding without explaining what the code is doing. I'd be surprised if anyone taking this course with little to no programming experience could follow along during the project.
results.content_html: It is misleading to label this course Advanced JavaScript but have the majority of course content geared towards people with little to no programming experience. The project at the end of the course is even more misleading. It hardly incorporates anything from the previous sections, introduces jQuery for the first time in the course, and spends 30 minutes coding without explaining what the code is doing. I'd be surprised if anyone taking this course with little to no programming experience could follow along during the project.

results.content: To mój pierwszy kontakt z Udemy i muszę przyznać, że jestem niemile zaskoczony. Poziom kursu, jego wprowadzający w błąd tytuł i brak profesjonalizmu prowadzącego są rażące... "Nauczyciel" wielokrotnie się myli, przestawione przykłady nie są przemyślane, często kończą się błędami, które (hic!) nie zostają przez prowadzącego naprawione. W związku z czym pozostajemy z odczuciem, że prowadzący tak naprawdę nie zna materii, którą próbuje przekazać. Wiele kwestii jest tylko zaznaczonych, a cały kurs sprowadza się w zasadzie to wykorzystania w kółko dosłownie kilku metod. Ponieważ czas jest dla mnie dobrem rzadkim, to było całkowicie zmarnowane 6 godzin. Nie polecam!

results.content:
So far things have been off to a slow start, but i'll keep with it and see what's coming.

Edit:
So far the course has been the instructor reading from W3 schools and MDN. His style is not that engaging and for a self-professed video guru he does a number of mistakes. Such as leaving the screen zoomed out making text hard to read. Leaving in mistakes and filler words. The worst one was reading every single point on the overview with no explaination as to what he would be talking about. It's an overview. Something more like: "We will be learning about JSON, including how it's formatted and what its uses are" "we will be learning about variables, contastants, flow control, loop contructs and more". I don't need a bulleted list read out to me.

While i appreciate you wanted to add the history of javascript, the presentation of the earlier sections is so off putting that I don't think many people will make it to the actual content they want to learn.
results.content_html:
So far things have been off to a slow start, but i'll keep with it and see what's coming.

Edit:
So far the course has been the instructor reading from W3 schools and MDN. His style is not that engaging and for a self-professed video guru he does a number of mistakes. Such as leaving the screen zoomed out making text hard to read. Leaving in mistakes and filler words. The worst one was reading every single point on the overview with no explaination as to what he would be talking about. It's an overview. Something more like: "We will be learning about JSON, including how it's formatted and what its uses are" "we will be learning about variables, contastants, flow control, loop contructs and more". I don't need a bulleted list read out to me.

While i appreciate you wanted to add the history of javascript, the presentation of the earlier sections is so off putting that I don't think many people will make it to the actual content they want to learn.

results.content:
Someone take this man's account away. He has no grasp on what he is talking about, and barely scratches the surface of any topic. "Everything you need to know about Advanced Javascript" covered in less than 90 minutes? That claim is just embarrassing.
It is painfully obviously this guy is just regurgitating whatever tutorials popped up on the first page of his Google  search for whatever lesson he is "teaching." skimmed through them once or twice the night before, and then smashed the screen record button. 
All this is, is Just churning out mindless, shallow content as fast as possible, and then obviously paying off shady characters who can barely speak English to leave hundreds and hundreds of (painfully fake, borderline gibberish) 5 STAR!!! reviews. What a joke. 
Not even worth it if free. Don't waste your time, let alone your money. You'd learn more typing the topic into YouTube and blindly clicking on the first free result.

All this is, is Just churning out mindless, shallow content as fast as possible, and then obviously paying off shady characters who can barely speak English to leave hundreds and hundreds of (painfully fake, borderline gibberish) 5 STAR!!! reviews. What a joke.

results.content:
I really hoped to learn a bit more. Especially about JSON and fetch API, constructor, class, but NO! It seems that the author doesn't have so much knowledge either - inheritence, Request, Response, POST, GET isn't explained.

Also, the course becomes fast boring because of the long pauses from the author (due to reading from a manual ) and the too short videos (0:28min). Furthermore he reads horible. 

This course im more like an audio book and not suited for beginners because the author doesn't give real examples and only write some comments like // Objects are surraunded by curly braces

This course souldn't call "JavaScript Ultimate Course", it's far away from ultimate.
The cours should call "Java Script beginner Audiobook of w3school"

results.content:
Tutor is just going over w3schools lessons using the same dumb examples. 

Final projects are just writing line after line of code without any explanation how the code interacts. He is basically writing a whole bunch of code with no testing and finally runs it. 

Not recommended. Stay away if you value your time

results.content: The intro part was good, very thorough. The actual writing of the project was a mess. We had no explaination of the code, we were introduced to many ids and classes that was in no way explained. It was 30 minutes of writing exactly like the instructor did, without knowing what it does or why. Just 30 min of copying. Didn't feel like I learned anything new, just a good repetitions of easy stuff before plunging into mysical and foreign code.

results.content: Per essere Javascript advanced non ci siamo... Il corso è scorrevole per un ripasso, ma quando viene mostrato il progetto finale, l'insegnante si limita a scrivere tutte le linee di codice senza spiegare la logica che ha adottato e non è che nelle lezioni precedenti siano stati dati tutti gli strumenti per capire il progetto finale... Migliorabile parecchio.

results.content:
This course is only showing the different examples of www.w3schools.com.
We get sample files that can be useful (except at the end, nothing...) but the videos are so boring and I am not sure at all that the teacher has a real experience in javascript (in fact I am pretty sure that he doesn't understand what he's doing!)
Useless...

results.content:
The taught concepts are just basic concepts of programming, wich are more or less the same across programming languages (Arrays, string functions etc...). This is nowhere near advanced JavaScript concepts.
On the other hand, when the project starts the code is only written down without any explanation and at this point many advanced JS concepts are being used without being taught or explained.

results.content: Esperaba que fuera algo más avanzado que lo que se explica, ya que la gran parte del curso se basa en explicar aspectos básicos del lenguaje. Sin embargo la sección 6 podría estar bien si se explicara cómo funciona con algo más de detalle el código que se usa para crear el proyecto. De todas maneras, es un buen curso para alguien que esté empezando a programar en Javascript
